pullRequest.body:
Some new results:

- `Subalgebra.LinearDisjoint.rank_sup_of_free`,
  `Subalgebra.LinearDisjoint.finrank_sup_of_free`:
  if subalgebras `A` and `B` are linearly disjoint and they are
  free modules, then the rank of `A âŠ” B` is equal to the product of the rank of `A` and `B`.

- `Subalgebra.LinearDisjoint.of_finrank_sup_of_free`:
  conversely, if `A` and `B` are subalgebras which are free modules of finite rank,
  such that rank of `A âŠ” B` is equal to the product of the rank of `A` and `B`,
  then `A` and `B` are linearly disjoint.

- `Subalgebra.LinearDisjoint.adjoin_rank_eq_rank_left`:
  `Subalgebra.LinearDisjoint.adjoin_rank_eq_rank_right`:
  if `A` and `B` are linearly disjoint, if `A` is free and `B` is flat (resp. `B` is free and
  `A` is flat), then `[B[A] : B] = [A : R]` (resp. `[A[B] : A] = [B : R]`).
  See also `Subalgebra.adjoin_rank_le`.

- `Subalgebra.LinearDisjoint.of_finrank_coprime_of_free`:
  if the rank of `A` and `B` are coprime, and they satisfy some freeness condition,
  then `A` and `B` are linearly disjoint.

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

using the following format:

-->

- [x] depends on: #17820

> This PR is very long.

Fine. I'll try to split this as two separate PRs. Note that the first one can only contain very basic results which can almost do nothing.
OK I've split half of them to #17820. It's 450 lines but I think it can't be shorten. Please review it first.

This PR is very long. Are you sure that you want a one field structure for your definition of `LinearDisjoint`?
This PR is very long. Are you sure that you want a one field structure for your definition of `LinearDisjoint`?

Any reason why this is a one-field structure and not an abbrev?

I'd suppose a lot of these lemmas will be unnecessary if it is an abbrev.

Originally it was `protected def LinearDisjoint := ...` but later it turns out that this will expose some unwanted lemmas for `Submodule.LinearDisjoint` (some of them have the same name, but different assumptions). In order to hide them from `Subalgebra.LinearDisjoint` I use this approach. Hopefully this will convince you.
So why not try making it an `abbrev`? Maybe it will reduce a bunch of code duplication? It's hard to get a PR merged if it's very long and relies on definitions which need some discussion.
OK let me think and try it again.
Seems that it's working; I can't use dot notation in a few places, see commit https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15346/commits/0e6961518ae56ef52f77fd8cab40953d6e1cc380
Can you make this into an instance? (`instance [Module.Flat R A] : Module.Flat R A.toSubmodule`)
Do you mean make it global for mathlib (which I think will have a performance impact), or only locally in this file?
I don't think there will be a performance impact.
PR created as #15360.
Done.

```suggestion
# Linearly disjoint subalgebras
```

```suggestion
This file contains basics about linearly disjoint subalgebras.
```

Why not drop the `op` and `of_commute` lemmas here -- this is Main results, not necessarily all results. Then you can just explain one lemma clearly instead of adding brackets to try and explain three lemmas in one sentence (and similarly for the next three).
OK.

```suggestion
The results with name containing "of_commute" also have corresponding specialized versions
```
